name: Morning Briefing
prompt:
[CRON: Morning Briefing] It's 7 AM — time to create today's daily execution view.

1. Read all GTD state files:
   - data/gtd/next-actions.md
   - data/gtd/routines.md
   - data/gtd/areas.md
   - data/gtd/waiting-for.md
   - data/gtd/inbox.md
   - data/state/world-model.md

2. Reset daily routine checkboxes in data/gtd/routines.md (uncheck all items under Daily)

3. Read data/gtd/today.md first. If a section for today's date already exists, SKIP creating a new one — just update the existing section if needed. Only append a new section if today's date is NOT already present. Format:

## YYYY-MM-DD (Day of Week)

### Morning Routine
- [ ] (items from routines.md > Daily > Morning)

### Today's Actions
- [ ] (top next actions from next-actions.md, prioritized)

### Daily Commitments
- [ ] (items from routines.md > Daily > Throughout Day)
- [ ] (weekly items due today from routines.md > Weekly)

### Follow-ups
- [ ] (any waiting-for items that need attention)

### Evening Routine
- [ ] (items from routines.md > Daily > Evening)

### Night Routine
- [ ] (items from routines.md > Daily > Night)

4. If inbox has unprocessed items, add a note at the top.
5. IMPORTANT: Append to today.md — do NOT overwrite previous days.
6. After writing, send a brief summary (3-5 bullet points) of today's priorities.

name: Evening Reconciliation
prompt:
[CRON: Evening Reconciliation] It's 10 PM — time to reconcile today.

1. Read data/gtd/today.md — find today's section (the last date header)
2. Read data/gtd/completed.md, data/gtd/next-actions.md, data/gtd/routines.md

3. For each item in today's section:
   - If checked [x]: Move to data/gtd/completed.md with timestamp (done: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM)
   - If unchecked [ ] and it's a next-action: Leave in next-actions.md for tomorrow
   - If unchecked [ ] and it's a routine: Note as missed (no action needed, resets tomorrow)

4. Add a summary line at the end of today's section in today.md:
   **Summary**: X of Y items completed. [brief note on what got done and what carried over]

5. Update any GTD files that changed.

6. Send a brief daily wrap-up: what was accomplished, what carries forward, and any items to be aware of tomorrow.
